snippet: Transformation of the Rolling Mill Hill section has undergone fits and starts in the last 14 years, but now it is progressing rapidly.
abstract: Nashville's Rolling Mill Hill section has been in some stage of redevelopment for 14 years; it is being rehabilitated as a mixed-use community, with $50 million invested and another $150 million in commercial and residential investment expected in coming years. Photo, Map (M)
lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE -- On a bluff overlooking the Cumberland River, the odd collection of trolley barns and old hospital buildings here known as Rolling Mill Hill has been in some stage of redevelopment for the last 14 years. The recession nearly halted work on the 34-acre site, which has been promoted as a mixed-use community for Nashville's creative class and a revival of a once-neglected section of this city of 600,000.

headline.main: Reversing Years of Neglect on a Hill Above Nashville
